abstract.p: Brookhaven National Laboratory names Samuel Aronson interim director (S)

block.p: Brookhaven National Laboratory will be led by Samuel Aronson from May 1 until a permanent director can be chosen later this year, the laboratory's governing board announced on Tuesday.

Mr. Aronson is the lab's associate director for high energy and nuclear physics. A resident of Poquott, he has worked at the lab since 1978, and oversaw the construction of one of its major experimental facilities, the relativistic heavy ion collider, which is used to study subatomic particles.
Brookhaven National Laboratory will be led by Samuel Aronson from May 1 until a permanent director can be chosen later this year, the laboratory's governing board announced on Tuesday.

Mr. Aronson is the lab's associate director for high energy and nuclear physics. A resident of Poquott, he has worked at the lab since 1978, and oversaw the construction of one of its major experimental facilities, the relativistic heavy ion collider, which is used to study subatomic particles.

The current director of the laboratory, Praveen Chaudhari, announced earlier this year that he would step down April 30 to become a part-time scientist at the lab, which is managed by a partnership between Stony Brook University and the Battelle Memorial Institute of Columbus, Ohio.
